message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lymphoma in the patient is consistent with Burkitt’s lymphoma, which is commonly associated with the t(8;14) translocation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lymphocytes with interspersed tingible body macrophages is characteristic of Burkitt lymphoma, which is associated with the t(8;14) chromosomal translocation. The other options are associated with other types of cancer.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest Burkitt lymphoma. Among the options, only t(8;14) is associated with Burkitt lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy result and positive Epstein-Barr virus serology suggests Burkitt lymphoma, which is most commonly associated with the t(8;14) chromosomal translocation. The other options are associated with other types of lymphoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy specimen shows sheets of lymphocytes with interspersed tingible body macrophages, which is indicative of Burkitt lymphoma. Chromosomal analysis shows that Burkitt lymphoma has a translocation of the c-myc oncogene involving the immunoglobulin heavy chain locus, which is t(8;14).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy of the mass and cervical lymphadenopathy suggest Burkitt lymphoma, which is associated with t(8;14) chromosomal translocation. The other options are associated with different types of lymphoma or sarcoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the biopsy specimen and positive serology for Epstein-Barr virus strongly suggests a diagnosis of Burkitt lymphoma. The most common chromosomal translocation found in Burkitt lymphoma is t(8;14).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy shows sheets of lymphocytes with interspersed tingible body macrophages, which is characteristic of Burkitt lymphoma. Among the options, only t(8;14) is associated with Burkitt lymphoma.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The biopsy findings suggest Burkitt lymphoma, which is associated with the t(8;14) chromosomal translocation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presentation of the patient suggests Burkitt lymphoma, which is characterized by a translocation of the c-MYC gene on the long arm of chromosome 8 to the heavy-chain immunoglobulin locus on the long arm of chromosome 14 (t(8;14)). The other options listed are associated with different types of cancer.
